sen.j: 青砥 藤綱（あおと ふじつな、生没年未詳）鎌倉時代後期の武士。
sen.e: Fujitsuna AOTO (dates of birth and death unknown) was samurai in the late Kamakura Period.
Fujitsuna AOTO (dates of birth and death unknown) was samurai in the late Kamakura Period.
Fujitsuna AOTO (dates of birth and death unknown) was samurai in the late Kamakura Period.

sen.j: 名は三郎・左衛門。
sen.e: His name was Saburo, Saemon.
sen.cmt: 「左衛門」の読み方が「さえもん」か「ざえもん」か確認できませんでしたが、「さえもん」で訳しました。
sen.e: His name was Saburo, Saemon.
His name was Saburo, Saemon.

sen.j: 出身は上総とも武蔵ともいう。
sen.e: He was said to be born in Kazusa Province or in Musashi Province.
He was said to be born in Kazusa Province or in Musashi Province.
He was said to be born in Kazusa Province or in Musashi Province.

sen.j: 青砥藤満の妾の子という伝承もあり。
sen.e: There is also a tradition that he was a child of a concubine of Fujimitsu AOTO.
There is a transmitted tale that he was a child by a concubine of Fujimitsu AOTO.
sen.cmt: 原文の「伝承」についてですが、この場合「tradition」などの一般訳があわないため、意訳したほうが良いと思います。前置詞用法を訂正しました。
sen.e: There is a transmitted tale that he was a child by a concubine of Fujimitsu AOTO.

sen.j: 『弘長記』によれば伊豆の武士で承久の乱で上総国青砥荘を領した大場近郷の子孫と伝えられる。
sen.e: According to "Kocho-Ki" (Records of Kocho era), it has been reported that he was a descendant of Chikasato OOBA who was samurai in Izu Province and owned Aoto-so in Kazusa Province in the Jokyu war.

According to "Kocho-Ki" (Records of Kocho era), it has been reported that he was a descendant of Chikasato OOBA who was samurai in Izu Province and given Aoto-so (manor) in Kazusa Province after the Jokyu war.
sen.cmt: 訳文は一部原文の意味を損ねている部分があります。「承久の乱で＿＿青砥荘を領した」は、「承久の乱の論功行賞で＿＿青砥荘を受領した」という意味だと思われます。校正では出来る限り訳文を直さない形で上記を反映したものに修正しました。
sen.e: According to "Kocho-Ki" (Records of Kocho era), it has been reported that he was a descendant of Chikasato OOBA who was samurai in Izu Province and given Aoto-so (manor) in Kazusa Province after the Jokyu war.

sen.j: 11歳の時に出家したものの、21歳の時に還俗して家に帰った。
sen.e: Although he became a priest when he was eleven years old, he returned to secular life and went home when he was twenty-one years old.
Although he became a priest when he was eleven years old, he returned to secular life and went home when he was twenty-one years old.
Although he became a priest when he was eleven years old, he returned to secular life and went home when he was twenty-one years old.

sen.j: 学問に優れ、儒教や仏教に広い知識を有していたという。
sen.e: It was said that he excelled academically and had a wide knowledge of Confucianism and Buddhism.
It was said that he excelled academically and had a wide knowledge of Confucianism and Buddhism.
It was said that he excelled academically and had a wide knowledge of Confucianism and Buddhism.

sen.j: 北条時頼が鶴岡八幡宮に参拝した日の夜、夢に神告があり、藤綱を召して左衛門尉を授け、引付衆とした。
sen.e: On the night of the day when Tokiyori HOJO visited Tsurugaoka Hachiman-gu Shrine, he had a revelation in a dream and thus called Fujitsuna to give him Saemon no jo (third-ranked officer of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards) and appointed him as Hikitsukeshu (Coadjustor of the High Court).

On the night of the day when Tokiyori HOJO visited Tsurugaoka Hachiman-gu Shrine, he had a revelation in a dream and thus called Fujitsuna to give him Saemon no jo (third-ranked officer of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards) and appointed him as Hikitsukeshu (Coadjustor of the High Court).

On the night of the day when Tokiyori HOJO visited Tsurugaoka Hachiman-gu Shrine, he had a revelation in a dream and thus called Fujitsuna to give him Saemon no jo (third-ranked officer of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards) and appointed him as Hikitsukeshu (Coadjustor of the High Court).

sen.j: 『弘長記』では評定衆に任じた、ともある。
sen.e: According to "Kocho-Ki", he appointed him as hyojoshu (a member of Council of State).
According to "Kocho-Ki", he appointed him as hyojoshu (a member of Council of State).
According to "Kocho-Ki", he appointed him as hyojoshu (a member of Council of State).

sen.j: 藤綱はその抜擢を怪しんで理由を問い、「夢によって人を用いるというのならば、夢によって人を斬ることもあり得る。功なくして賞を受けるのは国賊と同じである」と任命を辞し、時頼はその賢明な返答に感じるところがあったという。
sen.e: It was said that Fujitsuna was suspicious of this selection and asked why and declined the appointment saying "if you say you employ a person on the basis of a dream, it is possible that you would put him to the sword. A person receiving an award without his achievement is same as a traitor", then his sensible reply made Tokiyori feel something.

It was said that Fujitsuna felt strange for this selection and asked the reason, and then declined the appointment by saying, "if you say you employ a person on the basis of a dream, it is possible that you would put him to the sword also by mear dream. A person receiving an award without his achievement is same as a traitor"; his sensible reply impressed Tokiyori.
sen.cmt: 原文「抜粋を怪しんで」とあり訳文では「ーwas suspicious of the appointment」としていて、原文に忠実なのですが、直訳であり「suspicious」では邪推、疑り深いなど、この文に対しては意味が強いと感じました。「odd」あるいは「strange」が妥当と思いますが、「strange」を用いました。「asked why」とありますが、これは口語的ですので、「asked the reason」としました。「"if you say….would put him to the sword」の部分は、多少わかりづらく感じました。復唱することになりますが「dream」で説明を加え分かりやすくしました。「感じるところがあった」を「made__feel something」としていますが、直訳的ですので「impress」を用いました。
sen.e: It was said that Fujitsuna felt strange for this selection and asked the reason, and then declined the appointment by saying, "if you say you employ a person on the basis of a dream, it is possible that you would put him to the sword also by mear dream. A person receiving an award without his achievement is same as a traitor"; his sensible reply impressed Tokiyori.

sen.j: この時、藤綱は28歳であったという。
sen.e: It was said that Fujitsuna was twenty-eight years old at that time.
It was said that Fujitsuna was twenty-eight years old at that time.
It was said that Fujitsuna was twenty-eight years old at that time.

sen.j: ある人が時頼と所領を争ったさい、奉行人たちはその権威をはばかって敗訴としたのを、藤綱は道理を重んじて所領を返し、その人が謝礼に贈った銭をも返した。
sen.e: When a person conflicted with Tokiyori over shoryo (territory), bugyonin (magistrates) pronounced that the person lost the case in fear of Tokiyori's authority, but Fujitsuna placed importance on reason and returned shoryo to that person as well as the money offered by that person to Fujitsuna as reward.

Once, a person conflicted with Tokiyori over shoryo (territory) and bugyonin (magistrates) pronounced the verdict against the person in fear of Tokiyori's authority, but Fujitsuna placed importance on reason, and returned shoryo to that person as well as the money offered by that person to Fujitsuna as reward.
sen.cmt: 「-pronounced that the person lost the case」は間違いではありませんが、原文で「奉行人が（ある人を）敗訴とした」という意味が消え、単に「敗訴を言い渡した」という意味に取られてしまいます。原文に近い意味となるよう修正しました。
sen.e: Once, a person conflicted with Tokiyori over shoryo (territory) and bugyonin (magistrates) pronounced the verdict against the person in fear of Tokiyori's authority, but Fujitsuna placed importance on reason, and returned shoryo to that person as well as the money offered by that person to Fujitsuna as reward.

sen.j: これによりその公正・剛直が広く知られるようになった。
sen.e: This made his fairness and integrity become widely known.
This incident made his fairness and integrity widely known.
sen.cmt: 「This」で前項目を引き継いでいますが、ここは主語ですので再記述したほうが良いと思います。なお、この文で「become」は 「made」と重複するため不要と思いましたので削除しました。
sen.e: This incident made his fairness and integrity widely known.

sen.j: かつて夜に滑川を通って銭10文を落とし、従者に命じて銭50文で松明を買って探させたことがあった。
sen.e: He once sailed the Namegawa River at night and dropped a ten-mon coin (mon is a monetary unit of old times), he ordered his servant to buy taimatsu (a torch) for fifty-mon to search for the coin.

He once sailed the Namegawa River at night and dropped a ten-mon coin (mon is a monetary unit of old times), then he ordered his servant to buy taimatsu (a torch) for fifty-mon to search for the coin.
sen.cmt: 文意の異なる二文の接続部に接続詞を加え、二文の関係をはっきりさせました。マイナーfixです。
sen.e: He once sailed the Namegawa River at night and dropped a ten-mon coin (mon is a monetary unit of old times), then he ordered his servant to buy taimatsu (a torch) for fifty-mon to search for the coin.

sen.j: 「10文を探すのに50文を使うのでは、収支償わないのではないか」と、ある人に嘲られたところ、藤綱は応えて「10文は少ないがこれを失えば天下の貨幣を永久に失うことになる。50文は自分にとっては損になるが、他人を益するであろう。合わせて60文の利は大であるとは言えまいか」と。
sen.e: When a person laughed at him saying "if you spend fifty-mon to search for ten-mon, you will not make up for the loss", Fujitsuna responded "although ten-mon is small amount of money, but losing it means losing a coin of the country forever. Fifty-mon will be the loss for me but it will benefit someone else. Can't we say that the profit of sixty-mon in total would be big?".

When a person laughed at him saying "if you spend fifty-mon to search for ten-mon, you will not make up for the loss", then Fujitsuna responded, "although ten-mon is small amount of money, losing it means losing the money of the country forever. Fifty-mon will be the loss for me but it will benefit someone else. Can't we say that the profit of sixty-mon in total would be big?".
sen.cmt: 前項目と同様です。なお、藤綱の言葉「"although ten-mon…, but losing it...」と二重否定になっていますので、butを削除しました。「天下の貨幣」とあるため訳者はa coinで統一していますが、ここはより広義をしめしていると思いますので「the money of the country」となるようにしました。
sen.e: When a person laughed at him saying "if you spend fifty-mon to search for ten-mon, you will not make up for the loss," then Fujitsuna responded, "although ten-mon is small amount of money, losing it means losing the money of the country forever. Fifty-mon will be the loss for me but it will benefit someone else. Can't we say that the profit of sixty-mon in total would be big?"
sen.cmt: 句読点を修正しました。

sen.j: 次代執権の北条時宗にも仕え、数十の所領があり家財に富んでいたが、きわめて質素に暮らし倹約を旨とした。
sen.e: He also served the next regent Tokimune HOJO and had dozens of shoryo and many household possessions, but he lived a very simple life and made it his principle to be thrifty.
He also served the next regent Tokimune HOJO and had dozens of shoryo and many household possessions, but he lived a very simple life and made it his principle to be thrifty.
He also served the next regent Tokimune HOJO and had dozens of shoryo and many household possessions, but he lived a very simple life and made it his principle to be thrifty.

sen.j: 他人に施すことを好み、入る俸給はすべて生活に困窮している人々に与えた。
sen.e: He liked to give in charity and gave all the salary he received to people suffering from poverty.
He liked to give in charity and gave all the salary he received to people suffering from poverty.
He liked to give in charity and gave all the salary he received to people suffering from poverty.

sen.j: 藤綱がその職にあるときには役人は行いを慎み、風俗は大いに改まったという。
sen.e: It was said that during his term of office, government officials behaved cautiously and public morals were significantly improved.
It was said that during his term of office, government officials behaved moderately, and public morals were significantly improved.
sen.cmt: 「行いを慎む」で「behaved cautiously」とありますが、慎むというより藤綱の目を気にして注意深く行動した」というようなネガティブな意味を含むようになります。慎みにあう語をあてました。
sen.e: It was said that during his term of office, government officials behaved moderately, and public morals were significantly improved.

sen.j: なお、『太平記』では藤綱を北条時宗及び次代執権の北条貞時の時の人としている。
sen.e: In addition, "Taiheiki" (The Record of the Great Peace) called Fujitsuna the man of the moment in the time of Tokimune HOJO and the next regent Sadatoki HOJO.
By the way, "Taiheiki" (The Record of the Great Peace) pointed Fujitsuna as the person played active role during the period of Tokimune HOJO and the next regent Sadatoki HOJO.
sen.cmt: ここでの「なお、ー」は閑話休題、もしくはこういう話もある、という話の流れから逸れる意味ですので、「In addition」ではなく「By the way,」としました。「ーの時の人」を訳者は「ニュースな人」というように訳していますが、ここでは単純に「その時にいた人」という意味だと思います。ここではその折衷訳としました。
sen.e: By the way, "Taiheiki" (The Record of the Great Peace) pointed Fujitsuna as the person played active role during the period of Tokimune HOJO and the next regent Sadatoki HOJO.

sen.j: 『太平記』巻35においても藤綱の逸話が記され、『大日本史』にも載せられている。
sen.e: The anecdote of Fujitsuna was described not only in volume 35 of "Taiheiki" but also in "Dainihonshi" (Great history of Japan).
The anecdote of Fujitsuna was described not only in volume 35 of "Taiheiki" but also in "Dainihonshi" (Great history of Japan).
The anecdote of Fujitsuna was described not only in volume 35 of "Taiheiki" but also in "Dainihonshi" (Great history of Japan).

sen.j: また、現在の葛飾区青戸や横浜市金沢区富岡に屋敷があったとする伝承も存在するが、その実在には疑いが持たれている。
sen.e: Moreover, there is also a tradition that his residence was located in present Aoto, Katsushika Ward and Tomioka, Kanazawa Ward, Yokohama City, but its existence is questioned.
Moreover, there is also a transmitted tale that his residences were located in today's Aoto, Katsushika Ward and Tomioka, Kanazawa Ward, Yokohama City, but their actual existence is questioned.
sen.cmt: 先述の通り、伝承の訳を修正しました。屋敷について、二つの屋敷の説明ですので複数形に修正しました。
sen.e: Moreover, there is also a transmitted tale that his residences were located in today's Aoto, Katsushika Ward and Tomioka, Kanazawa Ward, Yokohama City, but their actual existence is questioned.

sen.j: 江戸時代には公正な裁判を行い権力者の不正から民衆を守る「さばき役」として文学や歌舞伎などの芸術作品にしばしば登場した。
sen.e: In the Edo Period, he often appeared in the works of art such as literature and kabuki as 'the role of justice' who offered a fair trial and protected people from injustice of powerful persons.
In Edo Period, he often appeared in the works of art such as literature and kabuki as 'the role of justice' who offered a fair trial and protected people from injustice of powerful persons.
sen.cmt: In the Edo Periodから定冠詞を削除しました。
sen.e: In Edo Period, he often appeared in the works of art such as literature and kabuki as 'the role of justice' who offered a fair trial and protected people from injustice of powerful persons.

sen.j: 同様の性格を持つものとしては大岡政談が挙げられるが、江戸幕府の奉行・大名であった大岡忠相を登場させることには政治的な問題が生じやすかったため、歴史上の人物であった藤綱を代わりに主人公とした例もある。
sen.e: Ooka Seidan can be given as an example having similar nature, but appearance of Tadasuke OOKA, who was bugyo (magistrate) and daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), on the scene was likely to cause a political problem and therefore, instead of Tadasuke OOKA, Fujitsuna who was a historical figure was the main character in some pieces of art.

Ooka Seidan (judgements of Ooka magistrate) can be given as an example having similar nature, but appearance of Tadasuke OOKA, who was the actual bugyo (magistrate) and daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) on the scene was likely to cause a political problem and therefore, instead of Tadasuke OOKA, a historic figure Fujitsuna appeared as the main character in some cases.
sen.cmt: 大岡政談の注釈を加えました。大岡が「実際の」奉行・大名であったと取れるよう修正しました。藤綱の説明部分は冗長ですので、簡略化しました。
sen.e: Ooka Seidan (judgements of Ooka magistrate) can be given as an example having similar nature, but appearance of Tadasuke OOKA, who was the actual bugyo (magistrate) and daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) on the scene was likely to cause a political problem and therefore, instead of Tadasuke OOKA, a historic figure Fujitsuna appeared as the main character in some cases.

sen.j: 文学作品としては月尋堂の浮世草子『鎌倉比事』や滝沢馬琴の読本『青砥藤綱摸稜案』が挙げられる。
sen.e: Ukiyozoshi (literally, Books of the Floating World) "Kamakura Hiji" written by Getsujindo and yomihon (books for reading) "Aoto Fujitsuna Moryo An" written by Bakin TAKIZAWA can be given as literary works.

Ukiyozoshi (literally, Books of the Floating World) "Kamakura Hiji" written by Getsujindo and yomihon (books for reading) "Aoto Fujitsuna Moryo An" written by Bakin TAKIZAWA can be given as examples among literary works dealing with Fujitsuna.
sen.cmt: 「can be give as literary works」ですと「ーが文学作品としてあげられる」となり、多少意味をなしませんので、説明を加えて前項目を引き継ぎ意味の通る内容としました。
sen.e: Ukiyozoshi (literally, Books of the Floating World) "Kamakura Hiji" written by Getsujindo and yomihon (books for reading) "Aoto Fujitsuna Moryo An" written by Bakin TAKIZAWA can be given as examples among literary works dealing with Fujitsuna.

sen.j: 歌舞伎においては市村座が藤綱関連の作品を積極的に行ったことが知られ、三世桜田治助と組んだ『青砥稿』・『名誉仁政録』、河竹黙阿弥と組んだ『青砥稿花紅彩画』が知られている。
sen.e: In Kabuki, Ichimura-za Theater is known to have actively performed masterpieces relevant to Fujitsuna and "Aotozoshi" and "Meiyo Jinsei Roku" in collaboration with Jisuke SAKURADA, the third, "Aotozoshi hana no nishikie" (Picture of flower of Aorozoshi) in collaboration with Mokuami KAWATAKE are known.

In Kabuki field, Ichimura-za Theater is known to have actively performed masterpieces relevant to Fujitsuna; "Aotozoshi" and "Meiyo Jinsei Roku" in collaboration with the third Jisuke SAKURADA, "Aotozoshi hana no nishikie" (Picture of flower of Aorozoshi) in collaboration with Mokuami KAWATAKE are known today.
sen.cmt: マイナーな修正を行っています。
sen.e: In Kabuki field, Ichimura-za Theater is known to have actively performed masterpieces relevant to Fujitsuna; "Aotozoshi" and "Meiyo Jinsei Roku" in collaboration with the third Jisuke SAKURADA, "Aotozoshi hana no nishikie" (Picture of flower of Aorozoshi) in collaboration with Mokuami KAWATAKE are known today.

sen.j: 菅専助・若竹笛躬の浄瑠璃『摂州合邦辻』も藤綱の子孫に起きた物語を描いている。
sen.e: Joruri (dramatic narrative chanted to a samisen accompaniment) "Sesshu Gappo-ga-tsuji" written by Sensuke SUGA and Fuemi WAKATAKE describes a story of a descendant of Fujitsuna.
Joruri (dramatic narrative chanted to a samisen accompaniment) "Sesshu Gappo-ga-tsuji" written by Sensuke SUGA and Fuemi WAKATAKE describes a story of a descendant of Fujitsuna.

sen.j: 京成高砂駅近くにある大光明寺（旧極楽寺）には、藤綱が奉納したといわれる弁才天像や江戸時代に建立された藤綱の供養塔がある。
sen.e: In Daikomyo-ji Temple (former Gokuraku-ji Temple) near Keisei Takasago station, there are a statue of Benzaiten (Sarasvati, Buddhist goddess of music, learning, eloquence, wealth, longevity, and protection from natural disasters) which Fujitsuna was said to dedicate and a memorial tower of Fujitsuna erected in the Edo Period.

In Daikomyo-ji Temple (former Gokuraku-ji Temple) near Keisei Line Takasago station, there are a statue of Benzaiten (Sarasvati, Buddhist goddess of music, learning, eloquence, wealth, longevity, and protection from natural disasters) that is said to be Fujitsuna's dedication and a memorial tower of Fujitsuna erected in Edo Period.
sen.cmt: マイナーな修正を行っています。「which Fujitsuna was said to dedicate」はあまり使わない言い回しですので修正しました。
sen.e: In Daikomyo-ji Temple (former Gokuraku-ji Temple) near Keisei Line Takasago station, there are a statue of Benzaiten (Sarasvati, Buddhist goddess of music, learning, eloquence, wealth, longevity, and protection from natural disasters) that is said to be Fujitsuna's dedication and a memorial tower of Fujitsuna erected in Edo Period.
